template.name: Template SNMPv2 Netgear Inventory
template.description:
Template used for FastPath to configure and report information and status of units, slots and supported cards.
Based on the NETGEAR-INVENTORY-MIB

item_prototype.name: Configured mode of stack port $1 on unit $2
item_prototype.description: Configured mode of the Stack Port.

application_prototype.name: SNMPv2 Netgear Inventory - Unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}, Stack Port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

item_prototype.name: Traffic on stack port $1 on unit $2
item_prototype.description:
Approximate data rate on the stacking port. Measured in Gb/s. Ports which are in ethernet mode will return 0.
According to the above MIB description the values should be in Gb/s, however, it seems that they are actually in Mb/s (at least that's what "show stack-port counter" on a M5300-28G with firmware 11.0.0.12 shows).

application_prototype.name: SNMPv2 Netgear Inventory - Unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}, Stack Port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

item_prototype.name: Errors on stack port $1 on unit $2
item_prototype.description: Approximate error rate on the stack port. Measured in Errors per Second. Ports which are in ethernet mode will return 0.

application_prototype.name: SNMPv2 Netgear Inventory - Unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}, Stack Port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

item_prototype.name: Speed of stack port $1 on unit $2
item_prototype.description: Speed of the Stack Port measured in Gb/s. Ports which are in ethernet mode will return a speed of 0.

application_prototype.name: SNMPv2 Netgear Inventory - Unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}, Stack Port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

item_prototype.name: Link status of stack port $1 on unit $2
item_prototype.description: Link status of the Stack Port. Ports which are in ethernet mode will return a status of down(2).

application_prototype.name: SNMPv2 Netgear Inventory - Unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}, Stack Port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

item_prototype.name: Operational mode of stack port $1 on unit $2
item_prototype.description: Currently operational mode of the Stack Port.

application_prototype.name: SNMPv2 Netgear Inventory - Unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}, Stack Port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

trigger_prototype.name: Link status down on {HOST.NAME} unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT} stack port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}
trigger_prototype.description: Link status of the stack port is NOT up(1) and stack port is NOT in operational mode ethernet(2) (as those will be always down according to the MIB description).

trigger_prototype.name: Operational mode on {HOST.NAME} unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT} stack port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG} changed to {ITEM.VALUE1}
trigger_prototype.description: Currently operational mode of the stack port changed.

trigger_prototype.name: Port utilization is high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_NETGEAR_INVENTORY_UTILIZATION_WARNING_TIME:"{#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}_{#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}"}) on {HOST.NAME} unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT} stack port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

dependency.name: Port utilization is very high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_NETGEAR_INVENTORY_UTILIZATION_HIGH_TIME:"{#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}_{#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}"}) on {HOST.NAME} unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT} stack port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

trigger_prototype.name: Port utilization is very high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_NETGEAR_INVENTORY_UTILIZATION_HIGH_TIME:"{#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT}_{#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}"}) on {HOST.NAME} unit {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTUNIT} stack port {#AGENTINVENTORYSTACKPORTTAG}

item_prototype.name: Code version of unit $1
item_prototype.description: The version of code running on this unit. If the unit is not detected then the code version is an empty string.

item_prototype.name: Management status of unit $1
item_prototype.description: Indicates whether the unit is a Management Unit, a Stack Unit, or has been configured to be a Management Unit.

item_prototype.name: Serial number of unit $1
item_prototype.description: The Serial Number of the unit.

item_prototype.name: Standby status of unit $1
item_prototype.description: The standby status of this unit.

item_prototype.name: Status of unit $1
item_prototype.description: The unit status of this unit.

item_prototype.name: Uptime of unit $1
item_prototype.description: The system up time of the unit.

trigger_prototype.name: Management status of unit {#SNMPINDEX} on {HOST.NAME} changed to {ITEM.VALUE1}
Standby status of unit {#SNMPINDEX} on {HOST.NAME} changed to {ITEM.VALUE1}
Status of {HOST.NAME} unit {#SNMPINDEX} not ok ({ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Status of Unit is NOT ok(1)
